name: Pythium aphanidermatum Pure Culture
remarks: Highly aggressive isolate (PYAP-PC) from root zone
overview:
Pythium aphanidermatum is an oomycete known to cause damping-off and root rot diseases, affecting a wide range of crops, particularly in warm and humid environments. It is a significant concern in greenhouse and field settings.
This culture is available for research in plant pathology, biocontrol, and disease management. Proper storage and handling are required to maintain culture integrity and viability.

types.as: Test tube slant 3 ml PDA + Grown culture from disc
Petriplate 15 ml PDA + Grown culture from disc
